content.p: Cookies help us to give you the best experience on our website. You can change your cookie settings if you wish. Otherwise we'll assume you're OK to continue.OKSee our policy Mathematics is a wide-ranging and versatile subject, and the range of careers open to mathematics graduates are varied. The University of Nottingham is consistently named as one of the most targeted universities by Britainâ€™s leading graduate employers* and can offer you a head-start when it comes to your career. * The Graduate Market 2013-2018, High Fliers Research Our graduates have gone on to success in a variety of careers including: Find out about Mathematics careers from the Council for the Mathematical Sciences What can I do with a mathematical sciences degree? "My masters in Financial and Computational Mathematics has been invaluable; offering me an excellent combination of financial and technical expertise. The trio of financial maths, computational maths and statistics and machine learning was excellent preparation for the modern financial world. So far my career has taken me to Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, London and I am now in New York working in a FX Trading Team. Living in Manhattan and walking down Wall St, past the NYSE every day, is something I never would have imagined possible" The Careers and Employability Service offers individual support to all undergraduate and postgraduate students whatever your course, mode of study or future career plans. Available support includes: The University of Nottingham University Park Nottingham, NG7 2RD For all enquiries please visit: www.nottingham.ac.uk/enquire
